title: Backend Engineer (Node.js AND Typescript)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about building scalable and efficient backend systems for headless ecommerce platforms? We are seeking a highly skilled Backend Engineer specializing in Node.js, TypeScript and Azure to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our development team, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining robust backend solutions that power headless ecommerce applications. You will work in an agile team and collaborate with our product managers, lead engineers, and frontend engineers to deliver high-quality, scalable, and resilient software solutions. The ideal candidate is passionate about backend development, has a strong understanding of JavaScript/ TypeScript principles, and keeps up to date with the latest trends and best practices in backend development using Node.js.
   

  

 In addition to the above, your role will involve:
   

  

**API Design** 
 : Collaborating on the design and implementation of APIs that facilitate seamless communication between the frontend and backend, ensuring an efficient flow of data in the headless ecommerce environment.
   

  

**Databases (SQL/ NoSQL)** 
 : Contributing to data modelling and database design, optimizing storage and retrieval mechanisms to align with the requirements of a headless ecommerce architecture.
   

  

**Azure Cloud** 
 : Leveraging your expertise in Azure Cloud services to enhance the scalability, reliability, and performance of our backend systems, ensuring a seamless integration with our headless ecommerce applications.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Backend Engineer with a focus on Node.js and TypeScript
* Expertise in API design and development, with a strong understanding of RESTful and GraphQL principles.
* Experience in integrating data from diverse sources into backend systems.
* Proficiency in database management (both SQL and NoSQL), with knowledge of data modelling and design principles.
* Experience in Azure Cloud services and their application in backend development.
* Familiarity with headless ecommerce architecture and best practices.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks and tools, such as Jest, Mocha, Chai, or similar.
* Knowledge about Containerization Technologies (Kubernetes) is a plus.
* Good to have knowledge on Centra (headless eCommerce) and Storyblok (headless CMS)
* Should have knowledge on CI/ CD pipelines using GitHub actions.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues, bugs, and performance bottlenecks.
* Conduct code reviews, identify areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Write clean, well-documented code and ensure proper version control using Git or other version control systems.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Additional Information**
**Benefits at H&M**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills, and ambitions are right, please send your resume (no need for a cover letter) as soon as possible. The responsible Recruiter is khrystyna hranda (khrystyna.hranda@hm.com)
   

  

 Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
We have partnered with a one of the largest banks within Scandinavia to assist with scaling a small team of software developers currently working on an internal trading platform. This team works along side traders to create a variety of tools assisting with position execution.
 



  





**The role:** 




  





 The client is a market leader in the trading space and is currently looking for senior backend developers to join and spearhead future developement. They are looking for driven individuals who are open to push the morn and build world class products.
 



  





  




* 8 Years + of experience in Software development
* Highly experienced within .Net / C#
* Strong experience within Cloud technologies (Azure)
* Experience within Docker / Kubernetes



  





  





**We offer** 




  





 We offer a dynamic working environment in the heart of Stockholm that focuses on allowing developers to develop. The current team works to a hybrid model and regularly enjoys team socials and collaborative work.
 



  





**Benefits Offered:** 



* 30 days holiday
* ITP1 Pension
* Education allowance
* Wellness allowance



  





 Unfortunately this opportunity cannot offer any form of VISA sponsorship.
 



  





 If this role could be of interest to you feel free to get in touch
 



  





 tim.stokes@parallelconsulting.com
 



 +46 85 502 486 58

title: Embedded Application Developer
description:
**We’re looking for Embedded Application Developer to join us on our journey.** 




  





**What you'll do:** 




  





 Join the team developing Electrolux’s next generation digital appliances. Build the user experience of our future appliance UIs and connected ecosystem. Work closely with the cross functional team to bring new consumer experiences from concept to launch with updates throughout product lifecycle. Bring the technical excellence and collaboration skills we need in the heart of our digital transformation.
 



  





**In detail, you will:** 



* Develop software using a pragmatic and modern embedded tech stack for connected appliances, with a primary focus on the logic needed to control and optimize how the appliance capabilities can be utilized to provide the best possible user experience.
* Ship small reliable frequent releases of production grade software together with the rest of the team.
* Wrap every release with a proper test coverage. You build it you own it.
* Work closely with Engineering Lead in order enhance and improve infra and CI/CD setup.
* Create and maintain modularized software that is scalable to different product capabilities, compute capabilities, brands, and markets.
* Work together with other developers, testers, designers, and product managers with shared responsibility for the teams’ success.



  





**Who you are:** 



* You have 3+ years experience in developing application code for embedded devices.
* You have experience in developing software applications for embedded internet devices that are frequently updated in production.
* You have experience in developing high abstraction level code with significant use of existing frameworks in Python, Rust or C++, C for embedded devices.
* You need to master at least two of the following competence areas and quickly learn what good looks like for the others:
* Layered software architecture for embedded systems with different chipset performance and configurable capabilities.
* Modular test automation for application logic in embedded products.
* Simulation and sandbox technology for rapid software development of embedded products.
* Build pipeline, code analysis, feature flag and analytics tools for modern embedded development.
* Service based architectures and pub/sub patterns used in multi-threaded embedded execution.



  





**Where you'll be:** 




  





 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
 



  





 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
 



  





**Benefits highlights:** 



* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

title: .Net utvecklare
description:
*Som utvecklare på Wasa Kredit spelar du en viktig roll i ett agilt team och bidrar till att säkerställa effektiva och stabila leveranser. Vi söker nu en modig, lösningsorienterad och tekniskt intresserad person som vill vara med och utveckla fantastiska lösningar för Wasa Kredit. Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team. Denna rekrytering avser fler tjänster.*
**Om jobbet**
 Nu söker vi utvecklare till avdelningen för Egenutvecklade applikationer och tjänster, ett av världens härligaste team med mycket hjärta. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i denna roll är följande:
   

  

* Hantera kundansökningar och följa upp affärsrelationer från start till avslut.
* Spela en central roll i Wasa Kredits ekosystem och bidra till att påverka både det funktionella och det tekniska.
* Skapa och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter för Wasa Kredit genom att utveckla och förbättra processer och system.


 På avdelningen för Egenutvecklade applikationer och tjänster får du möjlighet att arbeta med både front-end och back-end utveckling. Vi erbjuder en mix av nyutveckling, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av befintliga system, vilket innebär att det finns något för alla. Tillsammans med affären jobbar vi nära för att ta fram innovativa och användarvänliga lösningar som kan skapa nya affärsmöjligheter för Wasa Kredit. Du kommer att ha varierade arbetsuppgifter och ansvar för systemförvaltning.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid att ha roligt på jobbet och strävar efter att erbjuda en positiv arbetsmiljö där du kan trivas och utvecklas.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande:
   

  

* Har ett genuint intresse för programmering och drivs av att förbättra användarupplevelsen för våra kollegor och kunder.
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling.
* Besitter goda kunskaper inom NET 6 | React | AzureDevOps 2022.
* Besitter goda kunskaper i SQL och Rabbit MQ.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet från bank och finans.


 För att trivas i rollen som utvecklare inom Egenutvecklade applikationer och tjänster ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och trivs i en föränderlig miljö. Du är självgående och tar gärna initiativ till kontinuerliga förbättringar av metoder, verktyg och leveranser. Du är också engagerad i att hålla dig uppdaterad om relevanta tekniker och verktyg, deltar aktivt i teambeslut och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till dina kollegor på Wasa. Dessutom är det ett krav att kunna svenska flytande i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Exempel på vår Tech stack: NET Core |.NET 6 | React | AzureDevOps 2022 | Git | Octopus deploy | Docker | SQL Server | Rabbit MQ
   

  

**Om oss**
 Du kommer ingå i ett självständigt team som styr över sina arbetsprocesser och releaser av gruppens egna tjänster i en stimulerande domän. Du kommer att arbeta i en blandad arkitektur av beprövade teknik till helt nya, spännande supermoderna tekniker.
   

  

 Vi är en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till ett hållbart arbetsliv genom att erbjuda sjukvårdsförsäkring, friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension i anställningen. Bra anställningsvillkor och ett förmånligt försäkringsskydd till dig och familjen är andra exempel. Vi utvecklar ett flexibelt arbetssätt och med en god företagskultur skapar vi en attraktiv arbetsplats för alla att trivas i. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Observera att svarstiden för rekryteringsprocessen kan vara längre än vanligt, särskilt under semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.*
**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-30**
*Vi har i många år arbetat enligt vårt signum snabbt, enkelt, personligt och sätter stort värde i att våra kunder och samarbetspartner uppfattar oss som det. Våra framgångsfaktorer finns med i varje medarbetares vardag, för att ta fram ett nytt samarbetsavtal, hjälpa en kund eller utveckla ett nytt system.*
*Wasa Kredit kännetecknas av att vara varmt och välkomnande där vi behöver samarbeta för att kunna nå våra högt ställda mål. Wasa Kredit är helägt av Länsförsäkringar Bank och har ungefär 300 anställda. Länsförsäkringar äger gemensamt Länsförsäkringar AB, där Länsförsäkringar Bank ingår som ett dotterbolag. För ytterligare information se* 
 www.wasakredit.se
 *.*

title: Test Engineer- Mechanical Strength
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **2+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning** 
 :
   

  

 Hållbarhets- och utmattningstestning av mekaniska komponenter och system för lastbilar och bussar. Lastmätningar på hela fordon på testbana eller i testrigg.
   

  

**Var kommer uppdraget att utföras**
 (På plats, Hybrid, På distans) Uppdraget kommer att utföras som en hybridlösning på plats och på distans, men eftersom uppdraget är inom testområdet föredras arbete på plats.
   

  

**Utbildning**
 Civilingenjörsexamen, helst inom maskinteknik eller fordonsteknik.
   

  

**Språk**
 Språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska. Kommunikation på plats med design-, simulerings- och testkollegor sker främst på svenska.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Erfarenhet av hållbarhetstestning. Kunskap om Scanias utvecklingsprocess. Erfarenhet av kommersiella fordon.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: System Engineer (Power Inverter)
description:
Jing-Jin Electric(JJE) is seeking a
 ***System Engineer (Power Inverter)***
 to join our team!
 



  





 This is a full-time position as a System Engineer for automotive power electronics development team. With the support from engineering team, the candidate is responsible to work with customer to manage the project and provide technical support.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the weekly meeting with customer to provide development status update and issue tracking.
* Coordinate local and oversea team to track the development progress.
* Be the technical interface, debug the issue with customer.
* Provide on-site support.
* Work with internal and external customer teams, to create and review the technical specifications, define the software architecture and project plans.
* Diagnose, trouble-shooting and analyze root cause of failures. Implement effective solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet customer requirements and objectives.



  





**Requirements:** 
 Södertälje, Sweden,
 ***travel internationally up to 20%* 
 .** 




  





**Required Education and Experience:** 



* Master’s degree preferred, in electrical engineering.
* Minimum 2 years' experience of developing power inverter hardware or software.
* ***Fluent mandarin in oral and writing, which is a must-have language skill.***



  





**Specific Qualifications & Knowledge:** 



* 2+ years of developing power inverter for electric vehicle.
* Deep understanding of AC motor control.
* Familiar with calibration/measurement tool, including INCA, CANape, CANanlyzer, etc.
* Proven track record of working and leading local and oversea team.
* Ability to incorporate software requirements into software architecture efficiently and effectively.
* Strong teamwork, and excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to work independently, prioritize and manage work to meet critical deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem solving, sense of urgency and strong attention to detail.

title: Area Lead For Developer Experience Enablement
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands. We are accelerating digitalization, and to stay relevant, we need to ensure we have strong leaders in place to bring our best capabilities, innovation ideas, and talented technologists to support the transformation of H&M.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking an Area Lead to oversee our Developer Experience Enablement team. This role is will be working to ensure our development teams have the tools, processes, and environments they need to be productive and deliver high-quality software. As an Area Lead, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive initiatives that enhance developer satisfaction and efficiency.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead and mentor teams focused on improving developer experience.
* Collaborate with engineering, product, and design teams to identify and address developer needs.
* Develop and implement strategies to enhance the development workflow, including CI/CD pipelines, development environments, and code review processes.
* Advocate for developer needs and ensure their voices are heard in decision-making processes.
* Drive the adoption of best practices and new technologies to improve productivity and code quality.
* Monitor and analyze developer experience metrics to identify areas for improvement.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the team.
* Budget and staff responsibility


**Qualifications**
**Requirements:**
* Proven experience in a leadership role within a software development or developer experience team.
* Strong understanding of software development processes, tools, and best practices.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to think strategically and drive large-scale initiatives.
* Experience with CI/CD tools, development environments, and automation.
* Passion for improving developer productivity and satisfaction.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience in a large-scale tech environment.
* Familiarity with modern software development frameworks and languages.
* Previous experience in a developer advocacy or enablement role.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Description**
*Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.*
*Are you looking for an impactful job where you can contribute to every single part of the product and company culture? Are you based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!*
**About Palm Engineering**
 Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of five engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier 🏖️
   

  

 The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.
   

  

 Palm Engineering is defined by our principles:
   

  

* Bias to Action: In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.
* Open Communication: We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.
* Passion for Challenges: We love the problem and embrace challenges.


 In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!
   

  

**Our tech stack**
* Backend (Web App): Golang, GraphQL
* Frontend: TypeScript, React, GraphQL/Apollo
* Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
* Database: PostgreSQL
* Cloud: GCP
* Version Control: Git
* We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!


**How will you make an impact?**
* Design, prototype, build and own new product features
* Build the backend for our data-intensive web app
* Integrate with third parties such as banks and ERPs
* Improve reliability, observability and performance of everything mentioned above
* Write unit and integrations tests


**Our wish list** 
  

  

* 5+ years of backend development experience
* Experience with SQL
* Being proactive and love picking up new things
* Able to find a good balance between quality and speed of development
* Able to collaborate and clearly communicate your ideas
* High sense of ownership
* Nice to Haves:
+ Python or Golang
+ Experience with cloud deployments & writing Docker configurations


**Benefits Of Working At Palm**
* Travel 🛫 Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly off sites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Stockholm & Amsterdam.
* WeWork Membership 🏰 Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
* Stock Options 📈 Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
* Pension 🧑‍🌾 Everything you need to not worry about life after work.
* Health Insurance 🩺 Best-in-class local insurances to help you get treatment quickly whenever you may need it.
* Wellness Stipend 💆🏾 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.

title: SW Engineer
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. Our growing software development engineering team has opportunities in the development and testing of new and existing products. Our product teams thrive in a scaled, agile environment. Architects, product owners, designers and developers collaborate closely to rethink, reimagine, and create software that is simple, elegant, and easy to use. We want to make sure that physicians spend their time fighting cancer, not software.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 As a Software Engineer for the control systems teams, you will apply software design theories and principles to design and develop new or existing products in the control system of the Leksell Gamma Knife. The control system is a complex and integrated system that controls multiple axis in the machine to safely deliver radiation to the patient. The CS SW also includes a service application, and it provides the interface to the Treatment Planning Software. You will be contributing to all phases of the product creation and maintenance process including requirements, design, implementation, and testing. Additionally, you will work with tools and processes required for the operation, maintenance, and testing of the products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies and products
* Software implementations, primarily in C++ including unit integration and test
* Follow technical and clinical evolution within the field
* Actively contribute to developing the control system software team by suggesting process improvements, sharing knowledge, and taking responsibility for software code and design improvements
* Participating in requirements engineering and product risk management
* Ensure that software designs are safe and comply with all applicable regulatory standards


**What You Bring**
* Master of Science in Computer Science, Mechatronics, Engineering Physics or equivalent
* Excellent in English in speech and writing
* C++ programming
* Windows OS
* Familiarity with coding for Safety applications.
* Familiarity with implementing comms protocols such as USB, CAN, Ethernet and SPI/I2C
* Development of test frameworks and simulators (Python)
* Strong communication skills
* Couple years of work experience from development of embedded SW


**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 Last day for applying is 28 of August
 **.**
**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact the Global Talent Acquisition Partner responsible, Nidhi Sarkar at nidhi.sakar@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer.**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: Data Scientist
description:
My client is looking for a Data Scientist who has a real interest in a more programming heavy role, to join their vibrant team in their sleek Stockholm office.
   

  

 The company's main focus is working alongside businesses (small, medium and enterprise) to ensure that they are maximising their business operations; this includes anything from auditing, payroll to VAT accounting, declaration or business acquisition.
   

  

 They are now looking to build their impactful technology dept with a Data Scientist.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Enhance MLOps environment: Continuously improve the machine learning operations (MLOps) environment to streamline model deployment and monitoring processes.
* Work with Large Language Models (LLMs): Develop and optimize models using large language models to meet various project requirements.
* Deploy ML models to production: Manage the end-to-end deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient in production.
* Collaborate with internal teams: Partner with internal business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions.
* Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 2 years working as a Data Scientist or a Software/Data Engineer who's worked with building ML algorithms
* 2 years engineering experience with Python
* Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and others
* Worked with supervising models in production
* Familiar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMs
* It's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to production
* BSc/MSc in a relevant field
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 As a Data Scientist, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.
   

  

 Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

title: Data Engineer
description:
*Did you know that we have 500 million online visitors every year? Join our Data & ML Platform team and help promote a more data-driven development!* 




  





**Do you want to help us leverage the data from our 40M visits a month? Join our data journey and have an impact on Sweden's largest property portal. We need you to help us complete the transition from our current Data Warehouse into our new, full-fledged Data Platform. And then take it to the next level.** 




  





 Hemnet is the largest property portal in Sweden, and as such, we handle vast amounts of data and events related to the use of our website and apps. We believe that we have only scratched the surface when it comes to turning this data into new products and analyses, for user and market benefit.
 



  





**We are on an exciting journey to build a new Data Platform.** 
 We have several interesting challenges ahead of us before the new Data Platform is ready to serve all the data and events generated in the system, and cater to all of Hemnet’s needs for analytics, statistics, and all our data-driven product features. The main goals of the Data Platform are: All data in one place, and unified tracking.
 



  





**Technology that we use** 
 includes AWS & GCP, Airbyte, BigQuery, dbt, and server-side GTM.
 



  





**We see the need to strengthen our team of Data Engineers.** 
 We are now looking for a seasoned Data Engineer with solid knowledge from working with large amounts of data and events, building aggregation pipelines, and serving data to products and users from a Data Warehouse or a Data Platform.
 



  





 The Data Engineers at Hemnet are part of the Data and ML Platform team, which has an overall responsibility for supporting the whole organization with stable and performant platforms for data and MLOps, as well as development and training of ML models. We see great opportunities ahead leveraging our vast data sources to both broaden and deepen our analytics department, and to build new data-driven products to serve our customers.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 We have a beautiful office next to Hötorget and a hybrid-remote work setup
 **(not fully remote)** 
 , offering flexibility and balance. Enjoy 30 days of holiday plus 4 YOLO days, paid workouts, running classes/races, and flexible working hours. We provide comprehensive benefits to ensure you feel safe and supported, including pension benefits, parental leave top-up, and health insurance. Here’s our full benefit package 👈.
 



  





 Our culture of sharing includes lab weeks twice a year, Friday demos, dev brekkies, and brown bags. Hemnet is a place where you can be yourself and have fun with others. We actively encourage you to explore and share your other passions – whether it's producing music, painting, or playing with clay.
 



  





 Join us in crafting digital products that make a real impact!

title: ML Engineer - Stockholm - 6 months +
description:
Job Opportunity: Machine Learning Engineer in Stockholm
   

  


**Position:** 
 Machine Learning Engineer
   

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

**Duration:** 
 6 months + (with potential extension)
   

**Work Arrangement:** 
 Hybrid
 



**Are you a skilled Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP)? Join us in Stockholm and make a significant impact on AI/ML projects within the comprehensive fashion network of our prominent client.**



 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* **AI/ML Development:** 
 Develop AI/ML software products, explore large datasets, test and evaluate model outputs, and deploy scalable production solutions.
* **Data Infrastructure:** 
 Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data infrastructure for AI/ML projects.
* **Software Engineering:** 
 Utilize software architecture and design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, and well-designed code.
* **Frameworks & Services:** 
 Develop solutions and frameworks for feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B testing, versioning, and serving online and batch inference.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work in agile teams with engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem.


 Required Skills and Experience:
   

  

* **Professional Experience:** 
 4+ years in relevant roles as a Machine Learning Engineer.
* **Software Engineering:** 
 Hands-on experience with great software engineering skills, particularly in Python programming (4+ years).
* **Cloud Technologies:** 
 Expertise in GCP, including Vertex AI, and experience with MLOps practices.
* **Data Handling:** 
 Experience with high-volume heterogeneous data, both batch and stream, and development in DBT.
* **AI/ML Techniques:** 
 Strong working knowledge of various AI/ML techniques and frameworks.
* **Agile Practices:** 
 Familiarity with agile methodologies, team collaboration, and data-driven development.



 If you're passionate about machine learning and ready to take on new challenges, apply now to join our team in Stockholm!
 



**Apply Today at c.kaluza(a)globalenterprisepartners.com!** 




*Note: This is a hybrid position requiring both on-site presence in Stockholm and remote work flexibility.*

title: COBOL utvecklare
description:
Som Cobol-utvecklare kommer du att arbeta i ett agilt team som använder scrum och SAFe som ramverk. Du kommer att hantera utveckling och underhåll av systemintegrationer. Systemen är byggda i Cobol och körs på mainframe.
   

  

 Som en del av vår kunds leveransteam kommer du in i ett roligt och starkt sammansatt team. Du kommer ha regelbunden kontakt och samarbete med kollegor.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Du äger och driver din egen utveckling
* Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling av nya funktioner, underhåll och support av systemen
* Samarbeta med personer i teamet och mellan teamen
* Du är nyfiken på att använda nya verktyg som gör utvecklingen mer effektiv och skulle tycka att det är en rolig utmaning att lära dig icke-mainframe-system och verktyg om det behövs


**Vem vi söker**
 Du behöver ha ett kreativt tänka med lösningar på komplexa problem, gilla innovativa moderna teknologier och agila arbetsmetoder. Du är analytisk, nyfiken och har en passion för att upptäcka nya arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som person är du kommunikativ, driven och en lagspelare.
   

  

**Kunskapskrav:**
* Goda kunskaper i Cobol och mainframe-miljöer såsom Easytrieve, JCL, DB2, Fault Analyzer
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av lösningsutveckling i mainframe/zOS. Dessutom har du erfarenhet och god kunskap i iCobol, DB2/SQL, JCL och IDz.
* Meriterande om du har färdigheter i programmerings-/skriptspråk som Java, Python
* Implementera den kort- och långsiktiga strategin för att bygga, driva och underhålla lösningarna vi bygger
* Förfina strategin och definiera vår färdplan samt implementera den med dataägare, arkitekter, tekniska ledare och utvecklingsteam
* Du har arbetat som teknisk ledare och är van vid att driva, leda och innovera teknisk utveckling i linje med Target Architecture och affärsvision. Du är van vid att stödja dina teammedlemmar genom att leverera kunskap och vägledning i den tekniska visionen.
* Gillar att samarbeta med andra teammedlemmar och dela kunskap i teamet
* Du är flytande i engelska i tal och skrift


**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Erfaren utvecklare inom C# till Xylem!
Test Engineer (Mechanical or Electrical)
company: Piab - A brand by Piab Group
description:
**About Piab Group:** 




 At Piab Group, we enhance our customers' productivity, sustainability, and safety through evolving industrial automation and have been doing so since 1951. We believe in an automated world where no resources are wasted, and no humans are injured. With annual sales of ~3 billion SEK and more than 1200 employees, Piab is a global organization, serving customers in more than 100 countries from a vast network of subsidiaries and channel partners. Since 2018, Piab Group has been owned by Patricia Industries, part of Investor AB. Piab serves a wide range of industries, including e-commerce logistics, food and beverage, pharmaceuticals, and automotive, providing innovative vacuum automation solutions tailored to each sector.
 



**Job Mission:** 




 As a Test Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our mechatronic vacuum products. You will collaborate with a dynamic team to build test platforms, write test applications, and document test cases, contributing to our mission of advancing automation.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Conduct regression testing of mechatronic vacuum products
* Develop and build physical test platforms
* Write test applications using Python
* Create and document comprehensive test cases
* Together with the software team validate new product



  





**Requirements:** 



* Proven experience in regression testing
* Proficiency in programming, particularly in Python
* Self-motivated with the ability to set and achieve personal goals
* s.Strong team player with a willingness to learn new skill
* Solid understanding of Physics and Mathematics
* Basic knowledge of electronic design principles
* 2-5 years of relevant experience and a strong willingness to learn and adapt is more crucial than extensive experience
* To apply you must reside in Sweden and hold a valid work permit



  





 We offer a goal-oriented environment where the path to success is determined by your creativity and problem-solving skills. This role provides you with the freedom to be independent, find your own innovative solutions, and truly showcase your creativity.
 



  





**You can expect the following from us:** 



* **Innovative Cult** 
 ure: Be part of a team that thrives on creativity and innovation
* **Global Imp** 
 act: Work with a company that is a world leader in vacuum transport solutions
* **Global Prese** 
 nce: Piab has 25+ sales offices and over 900 partners worldwide, ensuring a vast network and global reach
* **Sustainable Vis** 
 ion: Contribute to an automated world, promoting safety and efficiency
* **Professional Gro** 
 wth: Access opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement
* **Diverse and Inclus** 
 ive: Join a workplace that values diversity and fosters an inclusive environment
* **Stable Emplo** 
 yer: As part of Patricia Industries and connected to the Wallenberg family, Piab benefits from strong support and a commitment to long-term growth and sustainability

title: Azure Integration Developer
description:
Are you a driven and experienced integration professional passionate about cloud technologies?Join our dynamic team at Dustin, where you'll drive innovation in Azure integrations and APIs while collaborating with a collaborative and knowledgeable team in a culture that celebrates creativity and problem-solving.
   





**This is what makes the position as Azure Integration Developer unique** 



* Work with an experienced team that fosters collaboration and knowledge sharing.
* Have great influence and autonomy in shaping solutions and driving projects.
* Focus on cutting-edge cloud technologies, including Azure Function, Logic Apps, and Cosmos DB.



 The hiring manager for the role is
 **Sara Wennerström** 
**, Manager- Services, Portals & Applications** 
 . She believes that the work is characterized by initiative, commitment, and a deep understanding of business processes and system support. As a manager, she is open and responsive, and strives to set and achieve goals together with her team. 
   





**Your role & influence as Azure Integration Developer** 




 You will be given responsibility for the development, support, and maintenance of Azure integrations and APIs with an opportunity to transition into a leading or an architect role. During the exciting transition to the cloud, you will also maintain the Biztalk environment.
 



*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of the development, support, and maintenance of Azure integrations and APIs, collaborating closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the ICT department and all other teams within Technology.
   





*Core activities* 
 : 
 


- Development of Azure integrations and APIs

- Solution architecture

- Maintenance and support


**Benefits of joining Dustin** 




 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. 
   





 You can find on our benefits below in the vacancy.
 



****This is what we imagine you bring****




 We envision you as a curious and driven individual with strong communication and coordination skills who brings with them around 5 years of excellent experience in working with Azure Function, Logic Apps, Service Bus, Cosmos DB, and APIM.
 




 Additionally, it'll be nice if you have:
 


* Bachelor's degree
* Experience with solution architecture and process development.



****What can you expect next?****




 We will treat your application anonymously. We expect the following steps in the recruitment process:
 


* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma
* 1st interview with the Hiring Manager, Sara
* 2nd (Technical) interview with two possible future colleagues.



 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**Introduction**
 We’re looking for our next Senior Site Reliability Engineer!
   

  

 Every unicorn company wants you to look at their shiny new stuff, but we know you’re smarter than that! You look at how well the gears turn and listen for any noise coming from the engine, so to speak.
   

  

 You have a strong urge to understand and learn how systems work (or shouldn’t work). You’re happy to step up, share what you know, and drive the changes needed to make systems and people live up to their full potential—if just “tweaked a little.”
   

  

 You are vocal—when you see something wrong, you tell the people who depend on it. You explain that it needs fixing, then help fix it or suggest how they do it.
   

  

 You understand the value of simple and solid, not over-engineered.
   

  

 If this resonates with
 **you,** 
 keep reading to see how we get things done in the team.
   

  

**As an SRE on the team, you will...** 
  

  

* Design, deploy and maintain cloud infrastructure
+ For designing and deployment we like Terraform (but as with any other tech company we have lots of options).
+ We maintain a multi-cloud footprint (Azure/GCP/AWS) but we try to go with Azure whenever possible.
+ For our edge tech we’re very good friends with Cloudflare.
+ Our systems are engineered across IAAS, PAAS and SAAS components (k8s, VMSS, AppServices, SQL, Mongo, Elasticsearch, DNS and a lot more)

* Work with monitoring, alerts & logs
+ We are consolidating our observability platform on Datadog but we run ELK & Azure AppInsight and others, as well.

* Be on call, respond to incidents and conduct post-mortems
+ When stuff break - we fix it. Simple as that.
+ Then we do retros, let people know why stuff broke and the outcome are improvement stories to get less oncall - this way, everyone wins!

* Build tools and automations
+ No one likes toil but we really we hate it (we still have it though…) So whenever possible - we automate the it. This means you need to know some scripting/programming like PowerShell, Bash or Python.
+ Then you do ‘GIT request-pull…’ to make sure we don’t have to do it again.

* Be scalable
+ We like to plan our work, not react to it.
+ We work according to process to cut down on overhead
+ Establish repeatable patterns (so you don’t have to reinvent the wheel all the time)
+ We don’t stick to a specific framework but we borrow from ITIL, SAFe and others when it brings us value.
+ Whenever possible we delete or simplify - the best part is no part.

* Most importantly - have fun!
+ You will spend a lot of your daytime (CEST) with us so we want you to have a great time!
+ Learn new tech - We get to play with a lot of new cool stuff
+ Bring your meme A-game :)


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
